Articles.Content: I am working on a 100 kerbal ssto and none of me ships saved in my SPH are showing up. they are in the save file but not showing up in the game

Hello, and welcome to the forums!

Can you explain a bit?  How are they "showing up in the save file" in the first place?  Are you saying that you created a craft in the SPH, and you saved it, and after saving it you go to load it again and it's not there?  Or something else?

Would help if you could describe the exact sequence of events, i.e.

  1. I create a craft in the SPH.
  2. I save it.
  3. ...?

6 minutes ago, Snark said:

Hello, and welcome to the forums!

Can you explain a bit?  How are they "showing up in the save file" in the first place?  Are you saying that you created a craft in the SPH, and you saved it, and after saving it you go to load it again and it's not there?  Or something else?

Would help if you could describe the exact sequence of events, i.e.

  1. I create a craft in the SPH.
  2. I save it.
  3. ...?

when i go into the save file they are in the SPH folder but when i go in game i don't see them in the SPH tab. I just tried makeing a plane saving it flying it landing it and recovering it and that save is doesn't show up in game but in the save file

12 minutes ago, SuperCookieGaming said:

when i go into the save file they are in the SPH folder but when i go in game i don't see them in the SPH tab. I just tried makeing a plane saving it flying it landing it and recovering it and that save is doesn't show up in game but in the save file

So, just to be clear:

  1. you made a craft in the SPH
  2. you saved it before launching
  3. after launching it, flying, and recovering, you go to the SPH and it's not there in the "load craft" dialog
  4. however, if you go look in your SPH folder, you see the .craft file for your ship

Is this correct?

(Sorry if this seems unnecessarily dense or nitpicky-- it's just that you keep saying "the save file", which is a bit ambiguous.  I want to make sure that by saying "show up in the save file" you mean "shows up as a .craft file in the SPH folder", and not anything involving a .sfs file in the saves folder.)

6 minutes ago, Snark said:

So, just to be clear:

  1. you made a craft in the SPH
  2. you saved it before launching
  3. after launching it, flying, and recovering, you go to the SPH and it's not there in the "load craft" dialog
  4. however, if you go look in your SPH folder, you see the .craft file for your ship

Is this correct?

(Sorry if this seems unnecessarily dense or nitpicky-- it's just that you keep saying "the save file", which is a bit ambiguous.  I want to make sure that by saying "show up in the save file" you mean "shows up as a .craft file in the SPH folder", and not anything involving a .sfs file in the saves folder.)

 

 

this is correct

  1. you made a craft in the SPH
  2. you saved it before launching
  3. after launching it, flying, and recovering, you go to the SPH and it's not there in the "load craft" dialog
  4. however, if you go look in your SPH folder, you see the .craft file for your ship
Hi @SuperCookieGaming, you have a corrupted craft file, can you remember the last vessel you were working on in the SPH?

1 hour ago, sal_vager said:

Hi @SuperCookieGaming, you have a corrupted craft file, can you remember the last vessel you were working on in the SPH?

I found my corrupted craft file, unfortunately it is my 100 kerbal ssto. is there anything i can do to fix it? Can i edit it in notepad?

It can be really hit or miss when trying to fix craft files, but yes you can open it in notepad, I'd make a backup first so you can go back to the original.

This happens when the write to the file is interrupted, usually because KSP (or the computer) crashed, so you might find there's a part that has an opening { but isn't closed with a }

8 hours ago, sal_vager said:

It can be really hit or miss when trying to fix craft files, but yes you can open it in notepad, I'd make a backup first so you can go back to the original.

This happens when the write to the file is interrupted, usually because KSP (or the computer) crashed, so you might find there's a part that has an opening { but isn't closed with a }

thank you i'll look
